verses.kjv: After these things, and the establishment thereof, Sennacherib king of Assyria came, and entered into Judah, and encamped against the fenced cities, and thought to win them for himself.
verses.ct: After all of this and Hezekiah's faithful work, King Sennacherib of Assyria invaded Judah. He set up camp around the fortified cities, intending to capture them for himself.

verses.kjv: And when Hezekiah saw that Sennacherib was come, and that he was purposed to fight against Jerusalem,
verses.ct: When Hezekiah realized that Sennacherib had arrived and was planning to attack Jerusalem,

verses.kjv: He took counsel with his princes and his mighty men to stop the waters of the fountains which were without the city: and they did help him.
verses.ct: he consulted with his officials and military commanders about blocking the water sources outside the city. They agreed to help him.

verses.kjv: So there was gathered much people together, who stopped all the fountains, and the brook that ran through the midst of the land, saying, Why should the kings of Assyria come, and find much water?
verses.ct: A large number of people gathered and blocked all the springs and the stream that flowed through the area. They said, "Why should the kings of Assyria show up and find plenty of water?"

verses.kjv: Also he strengthened himself, and built up all the wall that was broken, and raised it up to the towers, and another wall without, and repaired Millo in the city of David, and made darts and shields in abundance.
verses.ct: Hezekiah also took decisive action. He rebuilt every section of wall that had been damaged, raised towers on it, and constructed a second outer wall. He reinforced the Millo in the city of David and produced large quantities of weapons and shields.

verses.kjv: And he set captains of war over the people, and gathered them together to him in the street of the gate of the city, and spake comfortably to them, saying,
verses.ct: He appointed military commanders over the people, then assembled everyone in the open area by the city gate and spoke to encourage them:

verses.kjv: Be strong and courageous, be not afraid nor dismayed for the king of Assyria, nor for all the multitude that is with him: for there be more with us than with him:
verses.ct: "Be strong and brave! Don't be afraid or discouraged because of the king of Assyria or the massive army with him. The one on our side is greater than the one on his side.

verses.kjv: With him is an arm of flesh; but with us is the LORD our God to help us, and to fight our battles. And the people rested themselves upon the words of Hezekiah king of Judah.
verses.ct: He has only human strength, but we have the LORD our God to help us and fight our battles." The people drew confidence from the words of King Hezekiah of Judah.

verses.kjv: After this did Sennacherib king of Assyria send his servants to Jerusalem, (but he himself laid siege against Lachish, and all his power with him,) unto Hezekiah king of Judah, and unto all Judah that were at Jerusalem, saying,
verses.ct: Later, while King Sennacherib of Assyria was besieging Lachish with his full military force, he sent his officials to Jerusalem with this message for King Hezekiah of Judah and all the people of Judah living in Jerusalem:

verses.kjv: Thus saith Sennacherib king of Assyria, Whereon do ye trust, that ye abide in the siege in Jerusalem?
verses.ct: "This is what King Sennacherib of Assyria says: What are you relying on that makes you stay in Jerusalem under siege?

verses.kjv: Doth not Hezekiah persuade you to give over yourselves to die by famine and by thirst, saying, The LORD our God shall deliver us out of the hand of the king of Assyria?
verses.ct: Isn't Hezekiah misleading you into dying of hunger and thirst when he tells you, 'The LORD our God will rescue us from the king of Assyria'?

verses.kjv: Hath not the same Hezekiah taken away his high places and his altars, and commanded Judah and Jerusalem, saying, Ye shall worship before one altar, and burn incense upon it?
verses.ct: Isn't this the same Hezekiah who removed God's high places and altars and ordered Judah and Jerusalem, 'You must worship at only one altar and burn incense on it alone'?

verses.kjv: Know ye not what I and my fathers have done unto all the people of other lands? were the gods of the nations of those lands any ways able to deliver their lands out of mine hand?
verses.ct: Don't you know what my ancestors and I have done to all the peoples of other lands? Were the gods of those nations ever able to save their lands from my power?

verses.kjv: Who was there among all the gods of those nations that my fathers utterly destroyed, that could deliver his people out of mine hand, that your God should be able to deliver you out of mine hand?
verses.ct: Among all the gods of the nations my ancestors completely destroyed, which one was able to rescue its people from my power? So what makes you think your God can rescue you from my power?

verses.kjv: Now therefore let not Hezekiah deceive you, nor persuade you on this manner, neither yet believe him: for no god of any nation or kingdom was able to deliver his people out of mine hand, and out of the hand of my fathers: how much less shall your God deliver you out of mine hand?
verses.ct: So don't let Hezekiah fool you or talk you into this. Don't trust him. No god of any nation or kingdom has been able to rescue its people from my power or from the power of my ancestors. How much less will your God rescue you from my power!"

verses.kjv: And his servants spake yet more against the LORD God, and against his servant Hezekiah.
verses.ct: Sennacherib's officials said even more against the LORD God and against his servant Hezekiah.

verses.kjv: He wrote also letters to rail on the LORD God of Israel, and to speak against him, saying, As the gods of the nations of other lands have not delivered their people out of mine hand, so shall not the God of Hezekiah deliver his people out of mine hand.
verses.ct: Sennacherib also wrote letters insulting the LORD God of Israel, saying, "Just as the gods of other nations failed to rescue their people from my power, the God of Hezekiah won't rescue his people from my power either."

verses.kjv: Then they cried with a loud voice in the Jews’ speech unto the people of Jerusalem that were on the wall, to affright them, and to trouble them; that they might take the city.
verses.ct: Then they shouted loudly in Hebrew to the people of Jerusalem who were on the wall, trying to terrify and demoralize them so they could capture the city.

verses.kjv: And they spake against the God of Jerusalem, as against the gods of the people of the earth, which were the work of the hands of man.
verses.ct: They spoke about the God of Jerusalem the same way they spoke about the gods of other peoples on earth — as if he were just something made by human hands.

verses.kjv: And for this cause Hezekiah the king, and the prophet Isaiah the son of Amoz, prayed and cried to heaven.
verses.ct: Because of this, King Hezekiah and the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz prayed and cried out to heaven.

verses.kjv: And the LORD sent an angel, which cut off all the mighty men of valour, and the leaders and captains in the camp of the king of Assyria. So he returned with shame of face to his own land. And when he was come into the house of his god, they that came forth of his own bowels slew him there with the sword.
verses.ct: The LORD sent an angel who killed every mighty warrior, commander, and officer in the Assyrian king's camp. So Sennacherib returned to his own country in disgrace. When he entered the temple of his god, his own sons killed him there with a sword.

verses.kjv: Thus the LORD saved Hezekiah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem from the hand of Sennacherib the king of Assyria, and from the hand of all other, and guided them on every side.
verses.ct: In this way, the LORD rescued Hezekiah and the residents of Jerusalem from the power of King Sennacherib of Assyria and from every other threat, and he protected them on all sides.

verses.kjv: And many brought gifts unto the LORD to Jerusalem, and presents to Hezekiah king of Judah: so that he was magnified in the sight of all nations from thenceforth.
verses.ct: Many people brought offerings to the LORD in Jerusalem and valuable gifts to King Hezekiah of Judah. From that point on, he was highly respected among all the surrounding nations.

verses.kjv: In those days Hezekiah was sick to the death, and prayed unto the LORD: and he spake unto him, and he gave him a sign.
verses.ct: During that time, Hezekiah became deathly ill. He prayed to the LORD, who spoke to him and gave him a miraculous sign.

verses.kjv: But Hezekiah rendered not again according to the benefit done unto him; for his heart was lifted up: therefore there was wrath upon him, and upon Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.ct: But Hezekiah did not respond with gratitude equal to the kindness shown to him, because his heart became proud. So God's anger came against him, along with Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Notwithstanding Hezekiah humbled himself for the pride of his heart, both he and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so that the wrath of the LORD came not upon them in the days of Hezekiah.
verses.ct: However, Hezekiah humbled himself from his pride — both he and the residents of Jerusalem — so the LORD's anger did not fall on them during Hezekiah's lifetime.

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah had exceeding much riches and honour: and he made himself treasuries for silver, and for gold, and for precious stones, and for spices, and for shields, and for all manner of pleasant jewels;
verses.ct: Hezekiah accumulated enormous wealth and honor. He built treasuries for silver, gold, precious stones, spices, shields, and every kind of valuable item.

verses.kjv: Storehouses also for the increase of corn, and wine, and oil; and stalls for all manner of beasts, and cotes for flocks.
verses.ct: He also built storehouses for the harvests of grain, wine, and olive oil, along with stalls for every kind of livestock and pens for flocks.

verses.kjv: Moreover he provided him cities, and possessions of flocks and herds in abundance: for God had given him substance very much.
verses.ct: He acquired cities for himself, as well as vast herds of sheep and cattle, because God had given him tremendous wealth.

verses.kjv: This same Hezekiah also stopped the upper watercourse of Gihon, and brought it straight down to the west side of the city of David. And Hezekiah prospered in all his works.
verses.ct: This same Hezekiah blocked the upper outlet of the Gihon spring and redirected the water down to the west side of the city of David. Hezekiah succeeded in everything he undertook.

verses.kjv: Howbeit in the business of the ambassadors of the princes of Babylon, who sent unto him to enquire of the wonder that was done in the land, God left him, to try him, that he might know all that was in his heart.
verses.ct: However, when envoys from the rulers of Babylon were sent to him to ask about the miraculous sign that had occurred in the land, God withdrew from him to test him and reveal everything that was in his heart.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Hezekiah, and his goodness, behold, they are written in the vision of Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, and in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
verses.ct: The rest of Hezekiah's accomplishments, including his acts of devotion, are recorded in the vision of the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz and in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the chiefest of the sepulchres of the sons of David: and all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem did him honour at his death. And Manasseh his son reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: Hezekiah died and joined his ancestors. They buried him in the upper section of the tombs of David's descendants. All of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem honored him at his death. His son Manasseh became king in his place.
